author: GregoryMatveev
post_text: April 1, 2017 at 5:33 PM#1Hello All,Is there a way to do macro which make an execbutton empty?Smthg like ''Assign Flash @" but the other way around "Assign Empty @". Last one doesn't work.Thanks in advanceGregory

posts.author: GregoryMatveev
posts.post_text: April 1, 2017 at 5:33 PM#1Hello All,Is there a way to do macro which make an execbutton empty?Smthg like ''Assign Flash @" but the other way around "Assign Empty @". Last one doesn't work.Thanks in advanceGregory

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: April 1, 2017 at 9:35 PM#2yes this is possible - exactly as you describe: "Assign Empty @"

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: April 2, 2017 at 8:00 PM#4assume you wouldn't request missing functionality without using the current version, but just to make sure, you are running version 3.2.2.16 right?

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek

posts.author: GregoryMatveev
posts.post_text: April 4, 2017 at 4:33 PM#6Hello Ryan,i attach photo from my CL FeedbackSame as i did with FLash doesn't work with Empty, as i got MA doesn't know keyword "empty"Hello Glad,i'm on 3.1.2.5Thank youGregoryFilesIMG_8122.JPG.zip1.29 MB – 454 Downloads

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: April 4, 2017 at 4:43 PM#7Well that'll do it. As glad was implying, "Empty" as a keyword didn't exist in v3.1.2.5 - you could only do that through the Assign Menu GUI. To do what you're asking, you'll have to update to v3.2.2.16

posts.author: GregoryMatveev
posts.post_text: April 4, 2017 at 8:24 PM#8Thanks a bunch for this clarification guys.Gregory
